document.docTitle: Scrobipalpa erichiodes Bidzilya & Li, 2010, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Scrobipalpa Janse (Lepidoptera, Gelechiidae) in China, with descriptions of 13 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Scrobipalpa Janse (Lepidoptera, Gelechiidae) in China, with descriptions of 13 new species

Diagnosis .
Scrobipalpa erichiodes
sp. n. is superficially similar to
S. erichi Povolný, 1964
. The male genitalia are well recognizable by the broad saccus, comparatively long and direct valva, small but stout gnathos in combination with the basally constricted sacculus. In general the male genitalia resemble those of
S. gallincolella ( Mann , 1872 )
and
S. artemisiella (Treitschke, 1833 )
. The female genitalia resemble those of many
Scrobipalpa
species by having rounded postvaginal lobes which exceed anterior margin of sternite VIII, namely
S. gozmanyi
Povolný, 1969
,
S. gobica
Povolný, 1969
, and especially
S. gallincolella Mann
and
S. artemisiella mongolensis Povolný.

Biology . Larvae were reared from wattle of
Lycium barbarum Linn.
( Solanaceae ). According to label data, larvae of
S. erichiodes
and
S. parki
sometimes occur in the same host-plant.
Distribution . China (Gansu, Hebei, Heilongjiang, Inner Mongolia , Ningxia, Shaanxi, Xinjiang).

Etymology . The specific name indicates a close relationship of the new species with
S. erichi
.
